title: Can i be served papers at my place of employment
question: i owe a cash advance place and allstate is treatining me to come to my place of employment to serve me papers. they have called and been rude to my co workers. is it legal for them to do that?
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Employment,Lawsuits and disputes,Summons and complaint,Default judgment
answers: You can be served process in person anywhere you can be found, at work, at home, at a restaurant, a movie theater and on and on.

If they cannot serve you personally after reasonable diligence, then they can hand the summons and complaint to the person in charge at the office or workplace then mail a copy. It is illegal for them to call your workplace more than once to verify employment. The other calls are harassing and probably intended to embarrass you, which may violate the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. The Act permits an award for damages, costs, and attorney's fees if you were harassed illegally, but you have only one year to bring a claim for this misconduct.

If you have been served, you have 30 days to respond or a default judgment is taken. Please see my web site, linked below, for your options on what you should consider. You certainly should consider consulting an experienced debt collection defense attorney.
